Player History
Had first career hit on 4/3/1985, off Rich Bordi (NYY)...
Hit first career homerun on 4/21/1985, off Bill Mooneyham (OAK)...
Won World Series with Toronto in 1985...
Won Player of the Week award on 6/26/1986, hitting .522 with 2 HR, 6 RBI...
Won Batter of the Month award on 7/1/1986, hitting .356 with 7 HR, 21 RBI...
Was selected to the 1986 Allstar game...
Drove in 6 runs against Seattle on 5/16/1987...
Injured on 5/18/1987 with a Torn Hip Muscle, out for 3 weeks...
8/1/1987: Signed a contract extension with Toronto, $5,870,000 per year, for 3 years.
Won World Series with Toronto in 1987...
Released by Toronto on 10/27/1988...
Signed as a free agent by Detroit on 2/6/1989 to a 2-year deal worth $400,000 per year...
Released by Detroit on 4/18/1990...
